paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a single variant in the KCNH2 gene, specifically the L69P mutation, associated with Long QT Syndrome (LQTS).

individual_records.phenotype_details: suffering from dizziness and tachycardia, prolonged QT interval of 478 ms, documented torsades de pointes tachycardia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 35-year-old woman was suffering from dizziness and tachycardia in resting periods after physical stress.

functional_data.summary: The L69P mutation leads to a dominant negative effect on the trafficking of the hERG channel to the plasma membrane, resulting in reduced hERG current.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate, based on functional studies and previous associations with LQTS.
variants.additional_notes: The L69P mutation has been previously associated with Long QT Syndrome but had not been functionally characterized before this study.
key_quotes: Indeed the KCNH2 L69P mutation had already been previously associated with the Long-QT Syndrome (LQTS) [10] and was expected to be pathogenic according to bioinformatics prediction tools.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in the KCNH2 gene.
